February 24, 1985: Fiction
IF TOMORROW COMES, by Sidney Sheldon. (Morrow, $16.95.) A young woman
contrives to destroy the crime lords who got her an undeserved prison term.
THE SICILIAN, by Mario Puzo. (Linden Press/ Simon & Schuster, $17.95.) A
fictionalized life of Salvatore Giuliano, the Sicilian bandit-hero of the 1940's.
GLITZ, by Elmore Leonard. (Arbor House, $14.95.) The escapades, romantic and
melodramatic, of a cop on the lam from a murder case in Miami.
THE TALISMAN, by Stephen King and Peter Straub. (Viking, $18.95.) Two parallel
worlds and a young boy who can travel between them.
THE LIFE AND HARD TIMES OF HEIDI ABROMOWITZ, by Joan Rivers.
(Delacorte, $8.95.) The comedian tells the ''true story'' of her high school ''friend,''
a notorious tramp.
SO LONG, AND THANKS FOR ALL THE FISH, by Douglas Adams. (Harmony,
$12.95.) Suddenly returned to Earth, the hero of the ''Hitchhiker's Trilogy'' science
fantasy is confronted with new riddles to answer.
MOSCOW RULES, by Robert Moss. (Villard Books, $16.95.) A Soviet citizen,
angry at conditions behind the Iron Curtain, plots a new revolution.
THE FINISHING SCHOOL, by Gail Godwin. (Viking, $16.95.) A young girl's
relationship with an extraordinary older woman unintentionally leads to her
mentor's downfall.
LOVE AND WAR, by John Jakes. (Harcourt Brace Jovanovich, $19.95.) The Civil
War rages in this saga of a Pennsylvania family and a South Carolina family,
begun in ''North and South.''
ILLUSIONS OF LOVE, by Cynthia Freeman. (Putnam, $15.95.) A romantic
triangle that spans a quarter of a century, from an Italian village to Manhattan to
San Francisco.
SEE YOU LATER ALLIGATOR, by William F. Buckley Jr. (Doubleday, $15.95.)
John F. Kennedy sends Blackford Oakes to Havana on the eve of the Missile
Crisis.
JITTERBUG PERFUME, by Tom Robbins. (Bantam, $15.95.) Reflections on the
olfactory senses and the tyranny of growing old, presented in an idiosyncratic
fictional style.
THE FOURTH PROTOCOL, by Frederick Forsyth. (Viking, $17.95.) A London
jewel robbery leads to plots and counterplots behind the Iron Curtain.

February 24, 1985
Non-Fiction
IACOCCA: An Autobiography, by Lee Iacocca with William Novak. (Bantam,
$19.95.) The rise of the automobile executive from immigrants' son to top jobs at
Ford and Chrysler.
LOVING EACH OTHER, by Leo Buscaglia. (Slack/Holt, Rinehart & Winston,
$13.95.) Suggestions for ''setting our priorities right in order to enjoy life to the
fullest.''
CITIZEN HUGHES, by Michael Drosnin. (Holt, Rinehart & Winston, $18.95.)
Howard Hughes's attempts to control the Government during his last four years of
life.
SON OF THE MORNING STAR, by Evan S. Connell. (North Point Press, $20.) A
biography of George Armstrong Custer that is also a history of the Plains Indian
wars.
THE BRIDGE ACROSS FOREVER, by Richard Bach. (Morrow, $16.95.) The
author of ''Jonathan Livingston Seagull'' recounts his search for a true love.
A LIGHT IN THE ATTIC, by Shel Silverstein. (Harper & Row, $13.50.) Light verse
and drawings by the author.
MOSES THE KITTEN, by James Herriot. (St. Martin's, $9.95.) A waif kitten is
adopted by a pig; illustrated.
HEY, WAIT A MINUTE, I WROTE A BOOK! by John Madden with Dave
Anderson. (Villard Books, $14.95.) An anecdotal autobiography of the popular
television sports announcer.
''THE GOOD WAR,'' by Studs Terkel. (Pantheon, $19.95.) World War II as
remembered by men and women who lived through it.
PIECES OF MY MIND, by Andrew A. Rooney. (Atheneum, $12.95.) More essays
by the journalist and television commentator.
THE COURAGE TO CHANGE, by Dennis Wholey. (Houghton Mifflin, $15.95.)
Conversations with two dozen men and women, many of them celebrities, about
their problems with alcoholism.
DR. BURNS' PRESCRIPTION FOR HAPPINESS, by George Burns. (Putnam,
$11.95.) The octogenarian comedian provides a regimen of laughs.
CHOICES, by Liv Ullmann. (Knopf, $14.95.) The actress's experiences in Ethiopia
and other lands as a volunteer worker for Unicef.
THE SEVEN MOUNTAINS OF THOMAS MERTON, by Michael Mott. (Houghton
Mifflin, $24.95.) The life of the American religious writer and poet.
